clinical_study.brief_title: Neutrophil Extracellular Traps and Sickle Cell Disease

brief_summary.textblock: NETs formation in vaso-occlusive events in sickle cell disease and the role of hydroxyurea treatment.The study hypothesis is that NETs formation by neutrophils has a role in the induction of vaso occlusive disease in blood vessels. It is possible that high leukocyte count in children with sickle cell anemia is a bad prognostic sign due to NETs formation supporting occlusion of peripheral and central blood vessels.Hydroxyurea treatment might prevent vaso occlusive syndrome not only by increasing HbF but also by decreasing neutrophil count and inhibiting NETs formation.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at sickle cell crisis while hospitalized

other_outcome.time_frame: before and during treatment with hydroxyurea

biospec_descr.textblock: 10CC of peripheral venous blood will be collected from each patient at several time points: at diagnosis ,during pain crisis , at Hydroxyurea treatment.

study_pop.textblock: Infants and children who suffer from sickle cell disease and/or Infants and children with sickle cell disease treated with hydroxyurea at the pediatric hemato-oncology department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children who suffer from sickle cell disease and/or children with sickle cell disease treated with hydroxyurea
